definition: to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively

sentences.english: The dog has nipped the postmen on the leg.
sentences.chinese: 這條狗咬了郵遞員的腿。

sentences.english: It gave the job of carrying the letters to a new company -- the Overland Mail Company.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦政府將郵遞信件的任務交給了美國陸路郵遞公司。

sentences.english: It gave the job of carrying the letters to a new company -- the Overland Mail Company.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦政府將郵遞信件的任務交給了美國陸路郵遞公司。

sentences.english: That postman is in charge of this route.
sentences.chinese: 那個郵遞員負責這條投遞線路。

sentences.english: The postman comes at 6.30 in the morning, at which time I am usually fast asleep.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員早晨六點半就到，而這時我通常還熟睡着呢。

sentences.english: The mailman hasn't been round yet.
It was already the same technology they used for the mail.
sentences.chinese: 這和郵遞所使用的方式一模一樣。

sentences.english: There are a few Indian online bookstores, but they take weeks to deliver.
sentences.chinese: 少數的本地網絡書店提供郵遞，但時間往往長達幾周。

sentences.english: The price is including the post service in HK, if post to the other country will be charge the additional fee.
sentences.chinese: 價目只包本港郵寄服務，如海外郵遞服務須另加收費。

sentences.english: I can find the zip code in the phone book.
sentences.chinese: 我可以在電話簿上找到郵遞區號。

sentences.english: This information can be found by using your zip code or IP address.
sentences.chinese: 這方面的資料可以發現，用您的郵遞區號或IP地址。

sentences.english: I was very excited when I accepted the admission notice from the postman.
sentences.chinese: 我從郵遞員手中接過錄取通知書，心情非常激動。

sentences.english: Mailmen sort the mails at the post offices before distribution.
sentences.chinese: 郵件在寄走前由郵遞員在郵局分發。

sentences.english: Then the letter can bee - mailed to remote, high- altitude post - offices in this Himalayan region.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員是這些偏僻地區和外界聯繫的唯一方式。

sentences.english: The mailman collects the letters away every morning.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員每天早上來收信。

sentences.english: Post man impressed his seal on the envelope.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員在信封上印上他的私章。

definition: (international trade) documentation (e.g. a bill of lading)
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
email/abbr. for 電子郵件|电子邮件[dian4 zi3 you2 jian4]
to return merchandise/to withdraw a product
